data.title: Diocese of Honolulu
data.meta_description: A woman who enters consecrated life chooses to deepen her baptismal commitment by taking vows which emphasize the values of prayer, loving service, and simple living in community with others.
data.text:

Religious Life

Sisters

Sisters

"For us it is happiness to be able to comfort, in a measure, the poor exiles, and we rejoice that we are unworthy agents of our heavenly Father through whom He deigns to show His great love and mercy to the sufferers."

Blessed Mother Marianne Cope, 1884

A woman who enters consecrated life chooses to deepen her baptismal commitment by taking vows which emphasize the values of prayer, loving service, and simple living in community with others. Consecrated women in Hawaii serve the Church and community in many ways, including: youth ministry, homeless and hungry, battered women, education, healthcare, family life and parish pastoral ministry. Some Sisters are totally dedicated to the contemplative life.

The Diocese of Honolulu is blessed to have the following Women's Religious Orders providing loving service throughout the islands:

Benedictines (OSB)

A Public Association of the Faithful of Diocesan Right (OSB)

Congregation of the Sacred Hearts (SSCC)

Congregation of the Sacred Hearts of Jesus and Mary and Perpetual Adoration (SSCC)

The Mission of the Congregation of the Sacred Hearts of Jesus and Mary is to contemplate, live, and proclaim God's redemptive love. In working for the transformation of the human heart, we promote human dignity, live in solidarity with the poor, and strive for justice and peace. We are brothers and sisters collaborating in prayer, life, and ministry.

Little Sisters of Mary Immaculate of Gulu (LSMIG)

Little Sisters of Mary Immaculate of Gulu (LSMIG)

The LSMIG was started mainly for education of girls/women to help them to raise their dignity. Our motto is "Light in Darkness" and so he encouraged the sisters to be light to the world by their way of living, and to be true witnesses of Christ among the people with whom they work.

Maryknoll Sisters (MM)

Maryknoll Sisters of St. Dominic (MM)

We give witness to God's love and devote our lives in service overseas. As nurses, doctors, teachers, theologians, social workers, environmentalists, artists, and more. We serve the needs of the people - the poor, the ailing and the marginalized - where we are missioned.

Sisters of St. Joseph of Carondelet (CSJ)

The Sisters of St. Joseph seek our union of ourselves and all people with God and with one another in humility, sincere charity, and an orientation towards excellence, tempered by gentleness, peace and joy. To bring about unity, we undertake whatever works show forth the glory of God, especially alleviating the conditions which cause poverty, suffering and oppression, so as to bear the name of the Congregation of the Great Love of God.
